DataElement.preferredName: Heart Shortening Fraction Assessment Assessments Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was examination of left ventricle shortening fraction, measures and ratios the change in the diameter of the left ventricle between the contracted and relaxed states: the difference between LV end-diastolic diameter and LV end-systolic diameter over LV end-diastolic diameter.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related examination of left ventricle shortening fraction, measures and ratios the change in the diameter of the left ventricle between the contracted and relaxed states: the difference between LV end-diastolic diameter and LV end-systolic diameter over LV end-diastolic diameter.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

Property.preferredDefinition: The shortening fraction is a way of measuring left ventricle performance. The shortening fraction measures and ratios the change in the diameter of the left ventricle between the contracted and relaxed states. (from http://www.acor.org/ped-onc/survivors/cardio/cardiotests.html):Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: The fraction of the left ventricle diastolic dimension that is lost during systole; the measurement is calculated using the following formula: (end-diastolic dimension - end-systolic dimension) / end-diastolic dimension; the quotient is then multiplied by one hundred to be expressed as a percent.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
